definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: I did it for myself alone; that was the difference.
sentences.chinese: 這次非比往昔，這一次我是爲了我自己。

sentences.english: Today's Shanghai is quite different from what it used to be .
sentences.chinese: 今天的止海與往昔大不相同了。

sentences.english: The wind of anguish still hauls on them as usual.
sentences.chinese: 苦惱之風依然捲走它們一如往昔。

sentences.english: Something reminds me of auld lang syne .
sentences.chinese: 什麼東西使我想起了往昔的美好。

sentences.english: Illness which can eliminate the crime of our industry in the past.
sentences.chinese: 患病可以消除我們往昔當中罪業。

sentences.english: The rains will still come and the winds will still blow.
sentences.chinese: 掙扎與痛苦的日子仍將存在，風雨亦會一如往昔。

sentences.english: On the other hand, the bedrock23 of London's character and tradition remains the same.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，倫敦的基本特徵和傳統一如往昔。

sentences.english: The flight of time, in a short moment, everything into the distant past.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，彈指之間，一切都化爲遙遠的往昔。

sentences.english: Unable to bear lonely past, a light rain began work, calm and stable.
sentences.chinese: 耐不住往昔的落寞，小雨開始作祟，從容而淡定。

sentences.english: Looking eyes, people put the time arrow, how can look back to the past.
sentences.chinese: 回望眼，人存世間光陰箭，怎堪回首想往昔。

sentences.english: Back then, fears of a second Depression were widespread.
sentences.chinese: 回溯往昔，人們曾普遍對第二次經濟大蕭條感到恐懼。

sentences.english: We can"t help but compare today"s players with yester year.
sentences.chinese: 我們情不自禁地把今天的球員和往昔的球員比較。

sentences.english: Should auld acquaintance be forgot, And auld lang syne?
sentences.chinese: 豈可遺忘舊識，和那往昔的時光？

sentences.english: The shapes of the past dissolved and the future was free of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 往昔已斂跡循形，未來沒有云霧籠罩。

sentences.english: She didn't want to tell about bygone days.
sentences.chinese: 她不願講述往昔的事情。

sentences.english: XuanZu night jeong cheol, recall the past, and ultimately spared his life.
sentences.chinese: 宣祖夜訪鄭澈，回憶往昔，最終饒了他的性命。

definition: to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
as before/as usual/(to be) like old friends
to recollect/to recall (past times)/to look back
things have remained the same, but people have changed
